chapter.title: Financial management
chapter.para: The financial management module enables you to monitor financial transactions relating to the library's readership. These may be of various types :

listitem.para: dues on loans relating to one or more media types (for example, DVD), either as a whole, or based on the loan period...

Figure 9.1. Administration, Financial management
From this screen you can manage fines and suspension of loans.

sect1.title: Basic factors
sect1.para: How the financial management module functions in PMB rests on a number of factors which you need to understand fully to be able to use the module.

sect2.title: Types of readers' accounts
sect2.para: There are three types of accounts for each reader :

listitem.para: A membership account : in which shall be recorded financial transactions relating to membership
A loans account : in which shall be recorded the dues regarding the loan of certain types of documents (DVD for example)
A fines account : in which shall be recorded the fines relating to overdue items as well as the settlement of fines.

sect2.title: The Library account
sect2.para: Similarly the library owns an account that will enable staff to waive dues payable to the library in certain cases from readers' accounts.
This account can never be in credit. It is only a debit account listing clearances and cancellations of dues. In no circumstances shall it show a positive balance.

sect1.title: Managing loans rates
sect1.para: This refers to the advanced management of loans. If this entry is not visible, the management of loans rates is accessible in Administration > Copies > Media types.
If not, then the management of laons rates was not enabled. For more information, refer to the chapter titled Tools, section Parameters, item General Parameters.
The upper part of the screen displays the various types of possible loans rates. Click on one of these to define your corresponding rates.
The overall settings are found on the bottom half of the screen. You can define a default value as well as a directive to resolve conflicts (if two specified loans rates clash).
The ergonomics of loans rates management is the same as the one used in quota management.
For more details on the ergonomics of loans rates management, refer to the chapter Advanced quotas in this guide.

sect1.title: Managing fines
sect1.para: In Fines management, you can modify the settings regarding fines. To do this, click on the button Edit parameters.

figure.title: Administration > Financial management > Fines management, modifying parameters

sect1.para: You can define values for the following parameters:

Fine per day and per copy: idem.
You may give a decimal value; use a dot "." instead of a comma.

Grace period: even if the fine starts running from the very first day, the reader is deemed to be exempt from payment if he returns the work rapidly; it is only at the end of this period that will be generated the first overdue notice.
Delay before 2nd reminder:after the first overdue notice, usually very polite, a rather blunt tone can be used in the 2nd reminder.
Delay before the 3rd reminder : after the 2nd reminder, a third one abrupt can be despatched.

Delay before recovery: after a 3rd reminder without effect, the file is passed on to another structure responsible for recoveries (the Town Hall for a public library, the Accounts Department for a documentation centre, etc.)
Maximum fine per copy: amount at which the fine will stop accumulating.
With the settings given in example, on the date of transmission for recovery the total fine due will be: (15 + 15 + 15 + 7) x 0,15 or 52 â‚¬ to which shall be added the costs of the reminders.

sect1.title: Managing fines : reminders
sect1.para: On this screen you will be able to specify the costs of reminders for overdue loans.
To modify settings regarding the costs of reminders, click on Modify parameters.
You can modify the following settings :
Costs of the 1st reminder : refer to expenses incurred for sending the first reminder, in this case, they are based on postal rates for an ordinary mail.
Costs of the 3rd reminder: this reminder is usually sent by registered post with acknowledgement of receipt, which explains why the superior is higher.

Lost status for unreturned items : when the fine is transmitted for recovery to the relevant service, the item is generally deemed as definitely lost for the library; in which case the status "lost" or "missing" can be assigned to the item.

sect1.title: Suspension of loans
sect1.para: To modify the settings of loans suspension, click on the buttonEdit parameters.
You can:

listitem.para: suspend loans if the subscription account is outstanding
suspend loans if the loans account is outstanding
suspend loans if the fines account is outstanding
